questions.question: What is the mood at the opening of the play?

choices.answer: joyful
suspicious
exhausted
peaceful

questions.question: What happens when the flash of light passes over Maple Street?

choices.answer: All electronics stop working
Strangers from out of town arrive
Everyone looks for visitors from outer space
People put on their Ray Ban's

questions.question: At the opening of the play the residents of Maple Street seem -

choices.answer: Friendly with each other
Like a violent mob
Suspicious of one another
Like aliens of outer space

questions.question: What is Tommy's explanation for what is happening?

choices.answer: there was no flash
aliens have landed
it was thunder
it was a weather balloon

questions.question: When Tommy tells Steve Brand not to go downtown he says "They don't want you to."  Who is they?

choices.answer: Aliens from outer space
The residents of Maple Street
The housewives
Tommy's parents

questions.question: What assumption do the neighbors make about Les Goodman when his car starts automatically?

choices.answer: That he might be an imposter
That he might be an alien
That he might be a murderer
That he might be a magician

questions.question: Why do the residents start to believe Tommy's story?

choices.answer: They had read similar stories in books
Tommy has always told the truth before
Fear overtakes their good sense
They think it wise to consider every possibility

questions.question: At first, the residents do not believe Tommy's tale.  A complication arises when -

choices.answer: The lights suddenly go on at Steve's house
Les Goodman's car suddenly starts up
The neighbors find out that Les Goodman is an alien
The aliens send creatures to earth to prepare for landing

questions.question: All of the following make the residents nervous and suspicious except -

choices.answer: One man's power mower stops working
Tommy's computer starts displaying strange messages
A screeching roar is heard overhead
Mrs. Brand's stove stops working

questions.question: Which statement best describes a mob scene?

choices.answer: Individual voices are drowned out; fear and anger take over
Everyone works together to reach an agreement
Individual voices are heard; people act together
No one person is important; each individual is respected

questions.question: Whom does Charlie shoot with the shotgun and why does he shoot him/her?

choices.answer: Pete Van Horn because he thinks he's an alien
Steve Brand for not supporting him
Tommy for making up ridiculous stories
The women for becoming hysterical

questions.question: Who does Charlie use as a scapegoat (the person to blame) after shooting Pete Van Horn?

choices.answer: Tommy
Steve Brand
Les Goodman
Sally

questions.question: The residents of Maple Street turn against Les Goodman because they -

choices.answer: Like fifth columnists (traitors)
Don't like people with foreign cars
Distrust anyone who is different
Know the Goodman family owns a ham radio

questions.question: Why does Charlie shoot Pete Van Horn?

choices.answer: He thinks Pete caused the power failure
He believes Pete is making ham radios
He has seen Pete gazing at the night sky
He sees a dark figure approaching and thinks it's a monster

questions.question: At the end of the play, it turns out that the real monster is -

choices.answer: Tommy's mind
the fear and prejudice of human minds
Charlie's behavior
Steve's mind

questions.question: Based on his behavior throughout the play, what can you infer about Goodman based on his name?

choices.answer: He is a good man who has been falsely accused
He is "less of a man", an alien plotting to destroy the town
He is the narrator telling the story
He behaves less good and more bad by the end of the play

questions.question: Why did the writer most likely make the events occur on Maple Street, USA?

choices.answer: The aliens were told to find this street
Small towns are full of superstitious people
The main characters live on this street
It suggests that these events could happen ANYwhere

questions.question: At the end of the play, the residents of Maple Street are -

choices.answer: Resolving their problems
Meeting with the aliens
Turning on one another
Moving to another town

questions.question: By the end of the play, you can infer that aliens view humans as a group that -

choices.answer: Stand strong and united when faced with a crisis situation
Become distrusting & afraid when unexplainable events occur
Do not react at all in any situation.  They are emotionless
Runs away from a crisis rather than facing it head-on

questions.question: The main conflict in the play is:

choices.answer: People vs the people themselves
The aliens vs. the people
Charlie vs. Steve
Charlie vs.Tommy

questions.question: The theme of the play can best be expressed as:

choices.answer: Aliens may live among us
Strange events cause small-town people to destroy themselves
There are no such things as monsters
We as humans are our worst enemy

questions.question: How many broken screens (not caused by aliens) has Mrs. Young acquired in her lifetime?
andddd just for kicks...What does U.F.O. stand for?

choices.answer: United Futuristic Omelettes
Unidentified Flying Object
Unbelievable Financial Opportunity
Ugly Filthy Octopus
